When can i take the exam?

Hello!

You can take the State Certification Exam after completing your externship. Here are the upcoming exam dates available:

ğŸ“† Sep 26, 2025 â€“ One Day Class

Please remember to arrive half an hour early at 9:30 am. Exam dates are subject to change, and it's important to have all required documents and IDs ready to avoid any inconvenience.

Let us know if you have any more questions or need further assistance!

Best regards,
CNA Assistant Allie
Let us know if you have any questions.
I have my GED do I need anything else to start taking CNA?

Hello,

Great to hear that you have your GED! That's exactly what you need to start taking the CNA program at the Technical Institute of America. Just make sure to submit your GED by the end of the first week of your class schedule.

If you're ready to enroll, here are some upcoming class schedules in New York City:

ğŸ“Œ New York City
ğŸ“† Sep 15, 2025 â€“ Nov 6, 2025
ğŸ“‹ Monday - Thursday
â±ï¸ 6pm - 9:30pm

ğŸ“† Sep 22, 2025 â€“ Oct 30, 2025
ğŸ“‹ Monday - Thursday
â±ï¸ 9am - 1:30pm

Feel free to choose the one that best fits your schedule. If you need more information or assistance with the registration process, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Let us know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
CNA Assistant Allie
Are there any other requirements to take the class?

Hello,

In addition to your GED, there are a few more requirements and policies to keep in mind for the CNA program:

1. **Payment Schedule:** You will need to make several payments throughout the course:
   - First week of class: $339.80
   - Second week of class: $339.80
   - Third week of class: $339.80
   - Fourth week of class: $339.80
   - Fifth week of class: $339.80 (This payment allows you to attend the externship and the CNA state exam).

2. **Attendance Policy:** Attendance is mandatory on the first day of class. Regular attendance is crucial as it affects your grades and your ability to graduate. Missing more than 16 hours of class time will result in automatic withdrawal from the course.

3. **Dress Code:** You must wear a clean and ironed TIA uniform daily, with closed-toe shoes. Sandals, flip-flops, and other listed items are not permitted.

4. **Student Assessment Policy:** You must complete all course exams to meet the requirements for passing the course.

Please ensure you can meet these requirements before enrolling. If you have any more questions or need further clarification, feel free to reach out.

Let us know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
CNA Assistant Allie
Can I do the class I spanish?

Hello,

Currently, our CNA program classes are conducted in English. We do not have classes available in Spanish at the moment. If you have any concerns about language barriers or need additional support, please let us know, and we'll do our best to assist you.

Let us know if you have any more questions.

Best regards,
CNA Assistant Allie
